Evidence Con: As someone who spent two hours playing tennis today, and a soon-to-be member of my school's tennis squad, I will concede that tennis is a fun sport. But is tennis the best sport in the world? I strongly disagree. Jziggy claims that tennis is better than swimming because it is more social. However, the only time you will be playing with another member of your "team" is if you are playing doubles and even then that's just one other person. More often than not, you will be playing singles and will obviously be alone. Additionally, Jziggy claims that tennis is "more accessible and less of a bother" than swimming. If you plan to swim, you can go hop in the city pool or any body of water. Grab a pair of goggles and you're good to go. To play tennis, you have to locate a properly sized court equipped with a net and back fence, find a racket, tennis balls, tennis shoes, and a person to play with. More accessible and less of a bother? I think not. Jziggy classifies tennis as one of the few sports that strengthen your arms and legs. However, many sports fit this qualification such as baseball(our nation's pastime), hockey, American football, basketball, softball, track and field events, rugby, volleyball, and numerous other athletic pursuits. What evidence is there that proves tennis is better than all of these sports? In conclusion, I've rebutted all of Jziggy's limited arguments that allegedly crown tennis as the king of sports, over our nation's pastime and some of the most popular sports in the world, over age old traditions and sports than incite "March Madness" throughout America. Clearly, tennis is NOT the best sport in the world and does not deserve this generous title.
